full_description:
Employment Type:
Full time
Shift:
Rotating Shift
Description:
The Data Analyst ensures the quality and accuracy of data collection, aggregation, coordination and analysis to support the hospital-wide performance improvement plans, quality measures and regulatoryrequirements.Creates dashboards, statistical process control charts, and specialty
charts which measure performance. Builds reports, extracts and
analyzes data and prepares clinical data presentations from various
systems for decision making and support of patent safety and infection
reductions initiatives. Assists in monitoring action plans and measuring
outcomes from those efforts. Provides reports to clinical departments
analyzing any identified trends.
Manages confidential data sets for statistical and trend analysis;
develops procedures for gathering, entering , and reporting data to
assure accuracy and timely flow of information.
Assists practitioners with projects and provides, as needed, ideas for
said projects. Participates in special projects or committees as
requested working towards achieving overall department goals. Enters
data into the public health software in a timely manner to remain
compliant with this requirement.
Minimum Education:
Required:
Bachelors Degree OR equivalent training acquired via work experience or education
Preferred:
Bachelors Degree
Minimum Experience:
Preferred:
1-2 years of previous job-related experience
Loyola Medicine Core Values
\n
\n
Reverence
\n
We honor the sacredness and dignity of every person.
\n
\n
Commitment to Those Who are Poor
\n
We stand with and serve those who are poor, especially those most vulnerable.
\n
\n
Safety
\n
We embrace a culture that prevents harm and nurtures a healing, safe environment for all.
\n
\n
Justice
\n
We foster right relationships to promote the common good, including sustainability of Earth.
\n
\n
Stewardship
\n
We honor our heritage and hold ourselves accountable for the human, financial and natural resources entrusted to our care.
\n
\n
Integrity
\n
We are faithful to who we say we are.
Applicants for this position must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor an employment visa for this position.
COMPENSATION
Pay Range:
$22.07 - $34.21 per hour
Actual compensation will fall within the range but may vary based on factors such as experience, qualifications, education, location, licensure, certification requirements, and comparisons to colleagues in similar roles.
Trinity Health Benefits Summary
Our Commitment
Rooted in our Mission and Core Values, we honor the dignity of every person and recognize the unique perspectives, experiences, and talents each colleague brings. By finding common ground and embracing our differences, we grow stronger together and deliver more compassionate, person-centered care. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.
